name: Mango Pickle
history: Mango Pickle, known as 'Aam ka Achaar' in Hindi, is a staple in Indian households. Made from raw mangoes, it is a traditional way to preserve the tangy flavor of mangoes in a spicy, savory condiment that lasts for months.
description: Mango Pickle is made by marinating diced raw mangoes in a mix of aromatic spices, salt, and oil. This pickle is known for its bold, tangy, and spicy taste and is commonly served as a side dish with Indian meals.

instructions.title: Prepare the Mangoes
instructions.description: Wash and dry the raw mangoes. Dice them into small pieces, discarding the seed. Ensure the mango pieces are completely dry.

instructions.title: Mix Spices with Mangoes
instructions.description: In a large bowl, combine the diced mangoes with mustard seeds powder, fenugreek seeds powder, asafoetida, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to coat the mangoes evenly.

instructions.title: Add Oil and Vinegar
instructions.description: Pour mustard oil and vinegar over the spiced mangoes. Stir thoroughly to ensure all the pieces are well coated with the oil and spices.

instructions.title: Store the Pickle
instructions.description: Transfer the pickle mixture to a clean, dry jar. Seal the jar tightly. Let the pickle sit in a warm place for about 10 days for the flavors to develop.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Once the mango pickle is matured, it's ready to be served as an accompaniment to various Indian dishes.

tips: Make sure the mangoes and jar are completely dry to prevent spoilage.
The pickle's flavor enhances over time. Store it in a cool, dry place.
variations: Add garlic or ginger for additional flavors.
Adjust the spice levels to suit your taste.

storage.shelfLife: Can be stored for up to a year in a cool, dry place.
storage.instructions: Use a dry, clean spoon for serving. Keep the jar tightly closed.

presentationTips: Serve in a small bowl or directly from the jar.
Accompany with a platter of Indian bread and curries.
